pullRequest.body:
Add basic lemmas about number fields of odd degree. In particular, prove that the order of the torsion subgroup is equal to two. 

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [723a7712c2](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22297/commits/723a7712c234f62384e5c10c8b32cd0cf5b0fb77)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
|<details><summary>16 files</summary> `Mathlib.NumberTheory.Cyclotomic.PID` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.Cyclotomic.Three` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.FLT.Three` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.NumberField.AdeleRing` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.NumberField.CanonicalEmbedding.Basic` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.NumberField.CanonicalEmbedding.ConvexBody` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.NumberField.CanonicalEmbedding.FundamentalCone` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.NumberField.CanonicalEmbedding.NormLeOne` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.NumberField.CanonicalEmbedding.PolarCoord` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.NumberField.ClassNumber` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.NumberField.Discriminant.Basic` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.NumberField.EquivReindex` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.NumberField.House` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.NumberField.Units.Basic` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.NumberField.Units.DirichletTheorem` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.NumberField.Units.Regulator`</details>|1|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.CharP.NeTwo` (new file)|976|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ minimalPeriod_eq_prime_iff`
`+ neg_one_mem_torsion`
`+ nrRealPlaces_pos_of_odd_finrank`
`+ orderOf_eq_prime_iff`
`+ orderOf_eq_two_iff`
`+ torsionOrder_eq_two_of_odd_finrank`
`+ torsion_eq_one_or_neg_one_of_odd_finrank`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
@alainchmt, I see that you remove the `awaiting-author` tag but you haven't addressed my latest comment, I think.

LGTM. Thanks!
@riccardobrasca, I think this PR is ready for your final review.

:v: alainchmt can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Thanks!

bors d+

```suggestion
  refine (Nat.not_odd_iff_even.mpr ?_) h
  rw [← card_add_two_mul_card_eq_rank, hc, zero_add]
  exact even_two_mul (nrComplexPlaces K)
```

slight golf
I am a bit confused by this statement. I would rather prove something like: under `(h : Odd (Module.finrank ℚ K))`, if `x : torsion K`, then `x = 1` or `x = -1`.
Also, this result should be in the `torsion` section.
Surely, if you modify the above lemma as suggested, this can proved more directly.

Some various comments to improve the proof: 
- I think it would be easier if the condition was `2 < orderOf (x : (𝓞 K)ˣ)` instead (well, at least for the second case)
- Do not use `erw` unless you really have to. This is a code smell. You can use `erw?` to see what the problem is
- In the second case (assuming that the condition is `hc : orderOf ↑x ≤ 2`, you can use, after the `push_neg` line, 
`interval_cases h : orderOf (x : (𝓞 K)ˣ)`
  so that the goal splits into three cases with `orderOf (x : (𝓞 K)ˣ) = 0`, `1` or `2`.
- ~~The case of order `1` is direct using `orderOf_eq_one_iff`~~ (oh, you did use that)
- It would be nice if you could add the general lemma `orderOf_eq_two_iff` that says, under the right condition, that the only element of order `2` is `-1`.

Thank you for the comments! I have incorporated your suggestions. 
Following your advice, I would like to add the general lemma `orderOf_eq_two_iff` for nontrivial rings without zero divisors and characteristic away from 2 (see below), but I'm unsure where to place it. I considered including it in the GroupTheory.OrderOfElement file as it contains some lemmas regarding rings [LinearOrderedRing] and [CharP R p]. I was thinking of naming it `CharP.orderOf_eq_two_iff` (there is already a lemma named  orderOf_eq_two_iff for monoids of exponent 2). Would that be the right approach? 
```
lemma CharP.orderOf_eq_two_iff {R} [Ring R] [Nontrivial R] [NoZeroDivisors R] 
    (p : ℕ) [Fact (p ≠ 2)] [CharP R p] (x : R) : orderOf x = 2 ↔ x = -1 := sorry
```

You can try to see what `#find_home` says: 
```lean
#find_home CharP.orderOf_eq_two_iff
```
(and I think the name is fine)
Did you see [orderOf_neg_one](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/CharP/Two.html#orderOf_neg_one)?

Well, after thinking about it, I think the best way to proceed is to generalize [Function.minimalPeriod_eq_prime](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Dynamics/PeriodicPts/Lemmas.html#Function.minimalPeriod_eq_prime) to an equivalence, then deduce the equivalent version of [orderOf_eq_prime](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/GroupTheory/OrderOfElement.html#orderOf_eq_prime) and from there the proof of `CharP.orderOf_eq_two_iff` should be direct. 

Here is some (non-optimized) code: 
```lean
theorem Function.minimalPeriod_eq_prime_iff {α : Type*} {f : α → α} {x : α} {p : ℕ}
    [hp : Fact (Nat.Prime p)] :
    minimalPeriod f x = p ↔ IsPeriodicPt f p x ∧ ¬IsFixedPt f x := by
  rw [Function.isPeriodicPt_iff_minimalPeriod_dvd, Nat.dvd_prime hp.out,
    ← minimalPeriod_eq_one_iff_isFixedPt.not, or_and_right, and_not_self_iff, false_or,
    iff_self_and]
  intro h
  simpa [h] using hp.out.ne_one

theorem orderOf_eq_prime_iff {G : Type*} [Monoid G] {x : G} {p : ℕ} [hp : Fact (Nat.Prime p)] :
    orderOf x = p ↔ x ^ p = 1 ∧ x ≠ 1 := by
  rw [orderOf, Function.minimalPeriod_eq_prime_iff, isPeriodicPt_mul_iff_pow_eq_one,
    Function.IsFixedPt, mul_one]
```
(Sorry if that takes a bit far away from your initial goal but it is the way `Mathlib` development works in general 😅 )

No problem! I really appreciate the guidance! :) 
I have included your lemmas (with only slight changes to the proofs), and the lemma `CharP.orderOf_eq_two_iff ` for which I used `neg_one_eq_one_iff `, so I put it in that same file (after using #find_home) but I'm happy to change it if it's not the right location. I also adjusted the proof of the torsion elements using the new lemma.

Please put this result before `minimalPeriod_eq_prime` and deduce the proof of `minimalPeriod_eq_prime` from it. You can also add a comment like: `The forward direction of minimalPeriod_eq_prime_iff` (well, I guess it's more the `backward direction` ;)

Same thing for `orderOf_eq_prime` and `orderOf_eq_prime_iff`
This is the latest comment I see, and I made the corresponding changes in the latest commit. Perhaps I missed something?
Sorry, I forgot to submit my review. The new comments should be visible now.

It is indeed strange to put a result about odd characteristic in a file about characteristic two (although I understand the fact that you need `orderOf_neg_one`). 
If you cannot find a suitable place to put it, just make a new file, say `Odd`, in `Algebra.CharP`, and put it there.

I ended up creating a new file and adding it there. Since the lemma is also true if the characteristic is zero, I named the file `NeTwo` in `Algebra.CharP`. Of course, I'm happy to change if it is not ideal :)

I think a general result saying that `-1` is a torsion element, similar to [isUnit_neg_one](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Ring/Units.html#isUnit_neg_one), would be a good addition too.
Sounds good! I have included that as well

```suggestion
section

variable {M : Type*} [CommMonoid M] [HasDistribNeg M]

neg_one_mem_torsion : -1 ∈ CommMonoid.torsion M :=
  ⟨2, zero_lt_two, (isPeriodicPt_mul_iff_pow_eq_one _).mpr (by simp)⟩

end
```

This result is true in more generality
Right! Thank you. I've made the suggested changes

```suggestion
    (h : Odd (Module.finrank ℚ K)) : torsionOrder K = 2 := by
  classical
  refine PNat.eq (Finset.card_eq_two.2 ⟨1, ⟨-1, neg_one_mem_torsion⟩,
    by simp [← Subtype.coe_ne_coe], Finset.ext fun x ↦ ⟨fun _ ↦ ?_, fun _ ↦ Finset.mem_univ _⟩⟩)
  rw [Finset.mem_insert, Finset.mem_singleton, ← Subtype.val_inj, ← Subtype.val_inj]
  exact torsion_eq_one_or_neg_one_of_odd_finrank h x
```

Slight golf
Why not adding everything to `Mathlib.Algebra.CharP.Two`? It's just one lemma.
This one is on me: I thought it was strange to have a result about characteristic different than two in a file about characteristic two. But it can be moved back there if you think it's okay
Given it's just one lemma I think it is not worth to create a new file. We can always move it later if we think it is appropriate.
`Nontrivial R` is automatic here.

```suggestion
    [p_ne_two : Fact (p ≠ 2)] [CharP R p] {x : R} : orderOf x = 2 ↔ x = -1 := by
```

pullRequest.title: feat(NumberTheory/NumberField): torsion units in number fields of odd degree
